doc.body:
Directory Structure

project-folder
|-assets #directory contains your un-compiled assets such as Stylus or Sass files, images, or fonts
|-components #directory contains your Vue.js Components. You can't use either asyncData or fetch in these components.
|-layouts #directory includes your application layouts. Layouts are used to change the look and feel of your page.
|-middleware #directory contains your Application Middleware. Middleware lets you define custom functions that can be run before rendering either a page or a group of pages (layouts).
|-mixins
|-modules
|-pages #directory contains your Application Views and Routes. The framework reads all the .vue files inside this directory and creates the application router
|-plugins #directory contains your Javascript plugins that you want to run before instantiating the root Vue.js Application. This is the place to register components globally and to inject functions or constants.
|-shared
|-static #directory is directly mapped to the server root.
|-store #directory contains your Vuex Store files.
.env
.env.production
nuxt.config.json #file contains your Nuxt.js custom configuration.
package.json #file contains your Application dependencies and scripts.
